Package cosc202.andie

Class BrightnessContrast

java.lang.Object
cosc202.andie.BrightnessContrast
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageOperation, Serializable
public class BrightnessContrast extends Object implements ImageOperation, Serializable

ImageOperation to change the brightness and contrast of an image.

A colour value filter to change the brightness and/or contrast by changing each pixel's RGB values based of an equation provided in the lab book on BlackBoard (page 99).

COSC202 LabBook

See Also:
  • rgbMath(int)

  • Method Details

    • apply

      public BufferedImage apply(BufferedImage input)

      Apply a brightness/contrast change to an image.

      It apllies the percentage of brightness and contrast initalised in the constructor(BrightnessContrast) to the image.

      It goes though and changes the RGB values of each pixel separately. It then changes the colour or each pixel according to the new RGB values.

      Specified by:
      apply in interface ImageOperation
      Parameters:
      input - The image to have its colour values changed.
      Returns:
      The resulting (changed) image.

    • rgbMath

      public int rgbMath(int v)

      A method to calculate the new R,G or B values which need to change based on the brightness and contrast values initialised in the constructor (BrightnessContrast(int, int)).

      See the LabBook (page 99) for the equation used.

      Uses a method called inside(int) to make sure that the value remains in the valid range of 0-255.

      Parameters:
      v - The RGB value to be changed.
      Returns:
      The new changed RBG value.
      See Also:
      • inside(int)

    • inside

      public int inside(int x)

      A method to check if the RGB value lies in the appropriate range of 0-255.

      If the value is less than 0, the value gets changed to 0. If the value if more than 255, the value gets changed to 255.

      Parameters:
      x - Integer to check is in range.
      Returns:
      Checked integer between 0 and 255.
      See Also:
      • rgbMath(int)
